hw_name.description: This is the VESC Express Logging and Communication Module.

controller_id.description: CAN-Bus ID. Every devive on the CAN-bus needs a unique ID.

can_status_rate_hz.description: CAN Status message rate in Hertz for hardware that supports it (e.g. IO Boards). Setting this to 0 turns the status messages off. It is also the maximum rate at which GNSS-data is sent (although the GNSS output rate is limited to the rate of the GNSS module).

can_baud_rate.description: CAN-bus baud rate. Must be the same on all devices in the CAN-bus.

wifi_mode.description:
WiFi Disabled

Wifi is disabled.


Station

Station mode, meaning that the VESC Epress connects to an existing WiFi access point.


Access Point

The VESC Express becomes an access point itself that others can connect to.


NOTE:

Wifi-settings will be applied after a reboot.

wifi_sta_ssid.description: Wifi network SSID in station mode. Can usually be found on a sticker on the router.

wifi_sta_key.description: Wifi network password in station mode. Can usually be found on a sticker on the router.

wifi_ap_ssid.description: Wifi network SSID in access point mode. This name should show up when others are scanning for wifi networks.

wifi_ap_key.description: Wifi access point password.

use_tcp_local.description: Enable local TCP server. Allows connecting from the same network. Changing this setting takes effect after a reboot.

use_tcp_hub.description: Connect to TCP hub with the settings below. Changing this setting takes effect after a reboot.

tcp_hub_url.description: URL to the TCP hub.

tcp_hub_port.description: Port on the TCP hub.

tcp_hub_id.description: ID on the TCP Hub. Can be any string with at least 3 characters. Longer strings decrease the probability of id collisions on the HUB.

tcp_hub_pass.description: TCP Hub Password. Choose a password that is required to connecto to you on the TCP hub. Can be blank.

ble_mode.description:
Disabled

Bluetooth is disabled. Disabling bluetooth reduces the wifi-latency a bit, which is useful if you are not using bluetooth anyway.


Enabled

Bluetooth is enabled and anyone can connect to it with VESC tool.


Enabled and Encrypted

Bluetooth is enabled and pin code protected. That means that you have to do pairing and set up the pin code in order to connect with VESC tool.


Enabled with Scripting

Bluetooth is enabled and the LBM BLE extensions are enabled, allowing you to control the BLE behaviour of this VESC Express via LBM scripts. Note that it is not possible to connect to it with VESC tool via Bluetooth in this mode.


NOTE:

Bluetooth settings will be applied after a reboot.

ble_name.description:
Name of this VESC Express. Max 8 characters. The name will show up when scanning for bluetooth devices and in the wifi broadcast.


NOTE:

Bluetooth and wifi settings will be applied after a reboot.

ble_pin.description:
Bluetooth Pin Code. Must be 6 digits. Only used when Bluetooth mode is set to Enabled and Encrypted.


NOTE:

Bluetooth settings will be applied after a reboot.

ble_service_capacity.description:
How many service you can create via the LBM extensions. Each extra service that you add capacity for will use a few extra bytes at all times in addition to the memory that's consumed dynamically when they're actually added in LBM scripts. (This memory usage does not relate to the LBM memory.)


This setting only applies if Bluetooth Mode is set to Enabled with Scripting.


NOTE:

Bluetooth settings will be applied after a reboot.

ble_chr_descr_capacity.description:
How many characteristics and descriptors (added together) you can create via the LBM extensions. Each extra that you add capacity for will use a few extra bytes at all times in addition to the memory that's consumed dynamically when they're actually added in LBM scripts. (This memory usage does not relate to the LBM memory.)


This setting only applies if Bluetooth Mode is set to Enabled with Scripting.


NOTE:

Bluetooth settings will be applied after a reboot.

cells_ic1.description: Cells on first balance IC. Must be at least 3 and at most 16. If it is less than 16 and the second IC is used too, the last used cell on the first IC must be bridged to the last cell on the first IC.

cells_ic2.description: Cells on second balance IC. Must be at least 3 and at most 16. If only the first balance IC is used this can be set to 0.

temp_num.description: Number of external temperature sensors, starting from the first temperature port on the hardware. If this number is set higher than the hardware has sensors all sensors will be used.

batt_ah.description: Battery ampere hours for columb counting.

soc_use_ah.description: Use columb counting for SOC instead of the cell voltage. Columb counting is stable under load, but can drift over time especially when not charging the battery full.

block_sleep.description: Block sleep mode. This is useful for debugging and setting up the BMS for the first time. When the setup is done the sleep mode must be unblocked, otherwise the BMS will drain the battery.

max_bal_ch.description: Maximum number of simultaneous balancing channels.

vc_empty.description: Cell voltage when empty.

vc_full.description: Cell voltage when full.

vc_balance_start.description: Start balancing if cell voltage is this much above the minimum cell voltage.

vc_balance_end.description: Stop balancing when cell voltage is this much above the minimum cell voltage.

vc_charge_start.description: Start charging when the maximum cell voltage is below this voltage.

vc_charge_end.description: End charging when the maximum cell voltage is above this voltage.

vc_charge_min.description: Only allow charging if all cells are above this voltage.

vc_balance_min.description: Only allow balancing if all cells are above this voltage.

t_bal_max_cell.description: Disable balancing when the cell temperature is above this value.

t_bal_max_ic.description: Disable balancing when the BMS temperature is above this value.

balance_max_current.description: Only allow balancing when the current magnitude is below this value.

min_current_ah_wh_cnt.description: The current must be above this magnitude for the Ah and Wh couters to run.

min_current_sleep.description: Enter sleep mode when the current magnitude is below this value.

v_charge_detect.description: Charger detection threshold at charge port.

t_charge_max.description: Disable charging when the cell temperature is above this value.

t_charge_max_mos.description: Disable charging when the MOSFET temperature is above this value.

min_charge_current.description: Stop charging and disable charge port when the charge current goes below this value.

max_charge_current.description: Maximum allowed charge current.

sleep_regular.description: Time to sleep between polling for the charger and tracking state. If this time is shorter the BMS will react faster to e.g. plugging in a charger or data on the CAN-bus, but it will also draw more power.

sleep_long.description: Same as sleep time regular, but this time will be used when the SOC is below 5%. By making this time longer the BMS will drain the battery slower, but also react slower.

soc_filter_const.description: State of Charge filter constant. Range 0.1 to 1 000 000. Lower values give more filtering. 1 000 000 disables filtering.

t_charge_min.description: Disable charging when the cell temperature is below this value.

psw_t_pchg.description: Maximum precharge time. Give up precharge if the voltage does not rise to the threshold within this time.

psw_scd_en.description: Enable hardware shortcircuit protection.

psw_scd_tres.description:
Shortcircuit protection shunt voltage threshold. Trigger hardware shortcircuit protection when the voltage across the current sense shunt is at this value. The corresponding current will be this voltage divided by the shunt resistance.


Example


VBMS32 V1 has a 0.2 mOhm shunt. With a threshold of 100 mV, the protection will be triggered at


0.1 / 0.0002 = 500A

t_psw_en.description: Enable overtemperature protection.

t_psw_max_mos.description: Disable output when the MOSFET temperature is above this value.

psw_wait_init.description: Wait for full initialization before enabling the power switch. With this option enabled it will take longer to turn on the power switch after sleep (2 - 3 seconds longer), but it ensures that hardware shortcircuit detection is activated and that the correct cell voltage is used for precharging.
